content:
Diagnosis:		Advanced colon cancer with liver and peritoneal metastases
			Stage IV (T4a N2b M1c)
			KRAS-mutant adenocarcinoma, poorly differentiated

Treatment:		First-line FOLFOX with bevacizumab completed August 2023
			Progression on FOLFIRI initiated September 2023
			Capecitabine monotherapy started December 2023 but ceased due to progressive disease
			Palliative radiotherapy 10Gy/2# to L3 for symptomatic bone metastasis January 2024

Current Situation:	Symptoms of abdominal pain and anorexia with 5kg weight loss in 2 months
			CT abdomen March 2024 shows progression of liver metastases and new nodal disease
			Performance status declined to ECOG PS 2
			Worsening fatigue and inability to maintain daily activities
			Known history of melanoma treated with excision in 2018 with no recurrence

Assessment:
[redacted name] attended today's oncology clinic accompanied by his daughter. He describes worsening abdominal discomfort and anorexia over the past few weeks, associated with a significant weight loss of 5kg. On examination, he appears fatigued but is able to mobilize short distances with assistance. Abdominal examination reveals mild distension but no palpable masses. Recent CT imaging confirms disease progression, with increasing liver tumor burden and new retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy. 

Given his deteriorating performance status and progression on prior therapies, we discussed options for further treatment. Given the presence of KRAS mutation, systemic therapy with trifluridine/tipiracil was proposed as the next line of care. Supportive measures for symptom control were also reviewed.

Plan:		Initiate trifluridine/tipiracil starting April 2024, with close monitoring for toxicity
			Provide nutritional support and optimize symptom control with analgesics
			Plan reassessment with CT scan after 2 cycles to evaluate response
			Arrange palliative care referral to support symptom management and quality of life
